newsitem.title: FRANCE: French 96 budget deficit 287.9 bln Ffr-Lamassoure.
newsitem.headline: French 96 budget deficit 287.9 bln Ffr-Lamassoure.

text.p: The French government on Wednesday approved a revised budget for 1996 that will hold the central government budget deficit at 287.9 billion French francs ($56.93 billion), government spokesman Alain Lamassoure told reporters.
The 1996 budget originally fixed the central government budget deficit at 287.8 billion francs.
Lamassoure, speaking after a cabinet meeting, said the government was maintaining its objective of cutting its public deficits to four percent of gross domestic product in 1996.
Asked whether the government was holding to its target, Lamassoure said "Yes, absolutely."
Public deficits include the central government deficit, the welfare deficit and any local athority shortfalls.

The aim to bring deficits down to four percent of GDP this year and three percent next year from five percent in 1995 is meant to allow France to qualify for a single European currency when it is launched in 1999.
